definition: to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The crowd greeted the performers with boos and hiss es.
sentences.chinese: 觀衆向演出者發出一片噓聲。

sentences.english: Amanda:Tell your parents that the performer is a renowned soprano who seldom tours.
sentences.chinese: 告訴你父母演出者是一位很少巡迴演出的著名女高音。

sentences.english: The performer reformed the performsomece of the trsomesferredtrsomesformer.
sentences.chinese: 演出者改良了轉讓的變壓器的性能。

sentences.english: But the content and exaggerated performances are questionable.
sentences.chinese: 但其內容和演出者的誇張表演值得商榷。

sentences.english: All eyes were on the performer.
sentences.chinese: 所有的眼光都落在演出者身上。

sentences.english: How proud of you of your man here for the ensemble award?
sentences.chinese: 比起全體演出者，你爲你的男朋友感到有多驕傲呢？
胡躍是最安靜的演出者。

definition: to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
to perform on a musical instrument
sung performance/to sing for an audience
to perform (e.g. on the stage)/to lecture
